The sulfonamide group is also capable of strong intermolecular hydrogen bonding due to the presence of nitrogen and oxygen atoms, which should contribute an additional increase. The aliphatic carbon itself would have a minor effect, but it contributes minimal steric hindrance and molecular weight, so we expect it to have a moderate increase on the melting point due to the addition of a single carbon atom and the flexibility it provides might slightly reduce the effect of the rigid ring structures. Combining these effects: Benzene (+5.5°C), oxygen+nitrogen in the ring system (+100°C), sulfonamide group (+50°C), and aliphatic carbon (+1°C), one can predict the melting point.
